before_start:
1. Clean all surfaces and pipettors to remove DNA
  2. Label Plates
    • Plate #1 – 1ml collection plate
    • Plate #2 – 1ml collection plate
    • Plate #3 – 1ml collection plate
    • Plate #4 – 1ml collection plate
    • Plate #5 – 2ml collection plate
    • Plate #6 – 2ml collection plate
  3. UV Sterilize and Label reservoirs
    • Bead solution – 750ul/well
    • C1 – 60ul/well
    • C2 – 250ul/well
    • C3 – 200ul/well
    • C4 – 650ul/well
    • C5 – 500ul/well
    • C6 – 100ul/well

materials.reagent_name: PowerMag Soil DNA Isolation Kit (Optimized for KingFisher)
PowerSoil-htp 96 Well Soil DNA Isolation Kit (if KingFisher instrumentation is not available)
Swing bucket centrifuge capable of 4500 x g
Plate shaker with 4 metal plate adapters. This protocol uses the 96 well plate shaker (catalog #11996) listed on the MoBio website.

warning:
Please wear gloves at all times.

 

Please refer to the SDS (Safety Data Sheet) for hazard information.
authors: Donna Berg-Lyons,Chris L. Lauber,Greg Humphrey,Luke Thompson,Jack A. Gilbert,Janet K. Jansson,Rob Knight
guidelines:
MoBio PowerMag Soil DNA Isolation Kit (Optimized for KingFisher)

 

The Knight lab has transitioned to the PowerMag Soil DNA Isolation Kit (Optimized for KingFisher). We have validated a variety of sample types to ensure reproducibility when compared to MoBio PowerSoil Extraction Kit. This transition occurred to increase efficiency and reduce DNA extraction time from 6-8 hours to 2.5-3 hours.

 

The protocol is followed as MoBio recommends, with an added 10-minute water bath at 65°C after step 7.

 

The new kit can be implemented on the epMotion using a magnetic bead plate adapter for the epMotion. However, it does not reduce the amount of time the extraction takes by a significant amount: tests showed that the new kit on the epMotion took longer than the old kit. Comparison showed both the old and new kit performed well on the epMotion.

 

PowerSoil-htp 96 Well Soil DNA Isolation Kit

 

The MoBio PowerSoil DNA Isolation Kit is still compatible if KingFisher instrumentation is not available.

 

Items included in the extraction kit (for 1-96 well extraction)

  • (1) Bead plate
  • (1) Spin plate (filter)
  • (1) 0.5ml collection
  • (4) 1.0ml collection plates
  • (2) 2.0ml collection plates
  • (1) Microplate (DNA elution)
  • Sealing Tape
  • Centrifuge Tape
  • Elution Sealing Mat
  • Labeled solutions 

Important Considerations 

  1. Normal diameter 1 ml pipet tips are too large for some of the pipetting steps. To get around this problem we use a Rainin 300 ul 8-channel with filtered tips (Rainin #SR-L300F) and a Rainin 1000 ul 8-channel with extended length filtered tips (Rainin #RTS-L1000XF).
  2. Make sure that all of the necessary consumables and reagents are in place before you start the extraction. Remember, each pipetting step will require 1 box of 96 tips per plate.
  3. We use individually wrapped reagent reservoirs and expose them to UV light for 30 minutes prior to usage.
  4. In Step 10, it is important that the plate not rub against any surfaces in the shaker.
  5. Make sure that the alpha-numeric grid is in the same orientation across all the plates. On a few occasions we have noticed that the sticker is not always in the same position on the plate.
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: BEFORE THE FIRST USE ONLY, Solution C5-D must be prepared. Add an equal amount of 100% Ethanol to Solution C5-D (for the 4 prep kit = 120 ml, or for the 12 prep kit = 360 ml). Mix well. Put a check mark in the “ethanol added” box on the bottle cap label.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: BEFORE THE FIRST USE ONLY, Solution C5-D must be prepared. Add an equal amount of 100% Ethanol to Solution C5-D (for the 4 prep kit = 120 ml, or for the 12 prep kit = 360 ml). Mix well. Put a check mark in the “ethanol added” box on the bottle cap label.

components.data: Centrifuge Bead Plate for 1 min at 2500 x g to pellet the beads.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge Bead Plate for 1 min at 2500 x g to pellet the beads.

components.data: Remove the Square Well Mat from the PowerSoil®-htp Bead Plate and set aside.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the Square Well Mat from the PowerSoil®-htp Bead Plate and set aside.

components.data: Add 0.1 to 0.25 grams of soil sample or sample swab.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 0.1 to 0.25 grams of soil sample or sample swab.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 4 of Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) DNA extraction protocol
source_data.annotation: This is an appropriate stopping point and you can store the PowerSoil®-htp Bead Plate at 4°C covered with the Square Well Mat. This is the most time consuming step of the protocol. Care must be taken to avoid cross contamination between sample wells.
source_data.thread_text: This is an appropriate stopping point and you can store the PowerSoil®-htp Bead Plate at 4°C covered with the Square Well Mat. This is the most time consuming step of the protocol. Care must be taken to avoid cross contamination between sample wells.
source_data.body: This is an appropriate stopping point and you can store the PowerSoil®-htp Bead Plate at 4°C covered with the Square Well Mat. This is the most time consuming step of the protocol. Care must be taken to avoid cross contamination between sample wells.

components.data: Add 750 μl of PowerSoil®-htp Bead Solution to the wells of the PowerSoil®-htp Bead Plate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 750 μl of PowerSoil®-htp Bead Solution to the wells of the PowerSoil®-htp Bead Plate.

components.data: Check Solution C1. If Solution C1 has precipitated, heat solution at 60°C until the precipitate has dissolved.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Check Solution C1. If Solution C1 has precipitated, heat solution at 60°C until the precipitate has dissolved.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 6 of Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) DNA extraction protocol
source_data.annotation: Solution C1 contains SDS. If it gets cold, it will precipitate. Heating at 60°C will dissolve the SDS. Solution C1 can be used while it is still warm.
source_data.thread_text: Solution C1 contains SDS. If it gets cold, it will precipitate. Heating at 60°C will dissolve the SDS. Solution C1 can be used while it is still warm.
source_data.body: Solution C1 contains SDS. If it gets cold, it will precipitate. Heating at 60°C will dissolve the SDS. Solution C1 can be used while it is still warm.

components.data: Add 60 μl of Solution C1. Secure the Square Well Mat (from step 3) tightly to the plate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 60 μl of Solution C1. Secure the Square Well Mat (from step 3) tightly to the plate.

components.data: Place sealed plates in 65°C water bath for 10 min. DO NOT SUBMERGE THE PLATES.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place sealed plates in 65°C water bath for 10 min. DO NOT SUBMERGE THE PLATES.

components.data: Place PowerSoil®-htp Bead Plate between the aluminum plate adapters and securely fasten to the 96 Well Plate Shaker.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place PowerSoil®-htp Bead Plate between the aluminum plate adapters and securely fasten to the 96 Well Plate Shaker.

components.data: Shake at speed 20 for 20 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Shake at speed 20 for 20 minutes.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 10 of Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) DNA extraction protocol
source_data.annotation: It is important that the plate not rub against any surfaces in the shaker.
source_data.thread_text: It is important that the plate not rub against any surfaces in the shaker.
source_data.body: It is important that the plate not rub against any surfaces in the shaker.

components.data: Centrifuge at room temperature for 6 minutes at 4500 x g. While centrifuging, aliquot 250 μl of Solution C2 into each well of Plate #1 and cover with Sealing Tape.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at room temperature for 6 minutes at 4500 x g. While centrifuging, aliquot 250 μl of Solution C2 into each well of Plate #1 and cover with Sealing Tape.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 11 of Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) DNA extraction protocol
source_data.annotation: The Sealing Tape can be re-used when centrifuging Plate #1 in step 14 if handled carefully.
source_data.thread_text: The Sealing Tape can be re-used when centrifuging Plate #1 in step 14 if handled carefully.
source_data.body: The Sealing Tape can be re-used when centrifuging Plate #1 in step 14 if handled carefully.

components.data: Remove and discard the Square Well Mat from the Bead Plate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove and discard the Square Well Mat from the Bead Plate.

components.data: Carefully remove the Sealing Tape from Plate #1 and transfer the supernatant (~ 400-500μl) from the Bead Plate to Plate #1 and pipette up and down 4 times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully remove the Sealing Tape from Plate #1 and transfer the supernatant (~ 400-500μl) from the Bead Plate to Plate #1 and pipette up and down 4 times.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 13 of Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) DNA extraction protocol
source_data.annotation: The supernatant may still contain some particles.
source_data.thread_text: The supernatant may still contain some particles.
source_data.body: The supernatant may still contain some particles.

components.data: Re-apply the Sealing Tape to Plate #1. Incubate at 4°C for 10 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Re-apply the Sealing Tape to Plate #1. Incubate at 4°C for 10 minutes.

components.data: Centrifuge Plate #1 at room temperature for 6 minutes at 4500 x g. While centrifuging, aliquot 200 μl Solution C3 into each well of Plate #3, then cover with Sealing Tape.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge Plate #1 at room temperature for 6 minutes at 4500 x g. While centrifuging, aliquot 200 μl Solution C3 into each well of Plate #3, then cover with Sealing Tape.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 15 of Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) DNA extraction protocol
source_data.annotation: The Sealing Tape can be re-used when centrifuging Plate #3 in step 16 if handled carefully.
source_data.thread_text: The Sealing Tape can be re-used when centrifuging Plate #3 in step 16 if handled carefully.
source_data.body: The Sealing Tape can be re-used when centrifuging Plate #3 in step 16 if handled carefully.

components.data: After centrifugation, carefully remove and discard Sealing Tape from Plate #1.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After centrifugation, carefully remove and discard Sealing Tape from Plate #1.

components.data: Avoiding the pellet, transfer the entire volume (~600 μl depending on sample type) of supernatant in Plate #1 to Plate #2.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Avoiding the pellet, transfer the entire volume (~600 μl depending on sample type) of supernatant in Plate #1 to Plate #2.

components.data: Apply Sealing Tape to Plate #2 and centrifuge at room temperature for 6 minutes at 4500 x g.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Apply Sealing Tape to Plate #2 and centrifuge at room temperature for 6 minutes at 4500 x g.

components.data: Carefully remove Sealing Tape from Plate #2 and Plate #3.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully remove Sealing Tape from Plate #2 and Plate #3.

components.data: Avoiding the pellet, transfer the entire volume of supernatant (~600 μl) from Plate #2 to Plate #3 and pipette up and down 4 times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Avoiding the pellet, transfer the entire volume of supernatant (~600 μl) from Plate #2 to Plate #3 and pipette up and down 4 times.

components.data: Re-apply Sealing Tape to Plate #3. Incubate at 4°C for 10 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Re-apply Sealing Tape to Plate #3. Incubate at 4°C for 10 minutes.

components.data: Centrifuge at room temperature for 6 minutes at 4500 x g.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at room temperature for 6 minutes at 4500 x g.

components.data: Carefully remove and discard Sealing Tape from Plate #3.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully remove and discard Sealing Tape from Plate #3.

components.data: Avoiding the pellet, transfer the entire volume of supernatant (~750 μl) to Plate #4.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Avoiding the pellet, transfer the entire volume of supernatant (~750 μl) to Plate #4.

components.data: Apply Sealing Tape to Plate #4 and centrifuge at room temperature for 6 minutes at 4500 x g. While centrifuging, add 650 μl of Solution C4 to Plate #5.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Apply Sealing Tape to Plate #4 and centrifuge at room temperature for 6 minutes at 4500 x g. While centrifuging, add 650 μl of Solution C4 to Plate #5.

components.data: Avoiding any residual pellet, transfer up to 650 μl of supernatant in Plate #4 to Plate #5.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Avoiding any residual pellet, transfer up to 650 μl of supernatant in Plate #4 to Plate #5.

components.data: Add a second 650 μl (1300 μl C4 total) aliquot of Solution C4 to each well of Plate #5.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add a second 650 μl (1300 μl C4 total) aliquot of Solution C4 to each well of Plate #5.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 27 of Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) DNA extraction protocol
source_data.annotation: It is safe to stop the protocol at this step and store the samples covered with Sealing Tape at 4°C. Make sure to briefly centrifuge the plate to collect any condensate on the plate seal after overnight storage.
source_data.thread_text: It is safe to stop the protocol at this step and store the samples covered with Sealing Tape at 4°C. Make sure to briefly centrifuge the plate to collect any condensate on the plate seal after overnight storage.
source_data.body: It is safe to stop the protocol at this step and store the samples covered with Sealing Tape at 4°C. Make sure to briefly centrifuge the plate to collect any condensate on the plate seal after overnight storage.

components.data: Pipet samples “up and down” to mix.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipet samples “up and down” to mix.

components.data: Place Spin Plate onto Plate #6.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place Spin Plate onto Plate #6.

components.data: Load approximately 650 μl from Plate #5 into each well of the Spin Plate and apply Centrifuge Tape.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Load approximately 650 μl from Plate #5 into each well of the Spin Plate and apply Centrifuge Tape.

components.data: Centrifuge at room temperature for 5 minutes at 4500 x g.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at room temperature for 5 minutes at 4500 x g.

components.data: Discard the flow through and place the Spin Plate back on Plate #6. Carefully remove and discard the Centrifuge Tape.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard the flow through and place the Spin Plate back on Plate #6. Carefully remove and discard the Centrifuge Tape.

components.data: Repeat steps 30-32 until all the supernatant has been processed. Discard the final flow through.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Repeat steps 30-32 until all the supernatant has been processed. Discard the final flow through.

components.data: Place the Spin Plate back on Plate #6.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the Spin Plate back on Plate #6.

components.data: Confirm that ethanol has been added to Solution C5-D (see step 1). Add 500 μl of Solution C5-D to each well of the Spin Plate. Apply Centrifuge Tape to the Spin Plate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Confirm that ethanol has been added to Solution C5-D (see step 1). Add 500 μl of Solution C5-D to each well of the Spin Plate. Apply Centrifuge Tape to the Spin Plate.

components.data: Centrifuge at room temperature for 5 minutes at 4500 x g.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at room temperature for 5 minutes at 4500 x g.

components.data: Discard the flow through and place the Spin Plate back on Plate #6.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard the flow through and place the Spin Plate back on Plate #6.

components.data: Centrifuge again at room temperature for 6 minutes at 4500 x g.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge again at room temperature for 6 minutes at 4500 x g.

components.data: Discard the flow through.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard the flow through.

components.data: Carefully place the Spin Plate onto the Microplate. Remove Centrifuge Tape from the Spin Plate and discard.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully place the Spin Plate onto the Microplate. Remove Centrifuge Tape from the Spin Plate and discard.

components.data: Add 100 μl of Solution C6 to the center of each well of the Spin Plate. Apply Centrifuge Tape.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 100 μl of Solution C6 to the center of each well of the Spin Plate. Apply Centrifuge Tape.

components.data: Let C6 sit on the filter for 10 minutes at room temperature before final centrifugation step.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Let C6 sit on the filter for 10 minutes at room temperature before final centrifugation step.

components.data: Centrifuge at room temperature for 7 minutes at 4500 x g.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at room temperature for 7 minutes at 4500 x g.

components.data: Remove Centrifuge Tape and discard.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove Centrifuge Tape and discard.

components.data: Cover wells of Microplate with the Elution Sealing Mat provided. DNA is now ready for any downstream application. No further steps are required.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cover wells of Microplate with the Elution Sealing Mat provided. DNA is now ready for any downstream application. No further steps are required.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 45 of Earth Microbiome Project (EMP) DNA extraction protocol
source_data.annotation: Prolonged storage at 4°C will result in the evaporation of eluted DNA. We recommend storing DNA frozen (-20°C or -80°C). Solution C6 does not contain EDTA. To concentrate the DNA see the Hints and Troubleshooting Guide provided in the MoBio protocol.
source_data.thread_text: Prolonged storage at 4°C will result in the evaporation of eluted DNA. We recommend storing DNA frozen (-20°C or -80°C). Solution C6 does not contain EDTA. To concentrate the DNA see the Hints and Troubleshooting Guide provided in the MoBio protocol.
source_data.body: Prolonged storage at 4°C will result in the evaporation of eluted DNA. We recommend storing DNA frozen (-20°C or -80°C). Solution C6 does not contain EDTA. To concentrate the DNA see the Hints and Troubleshooting Guide provided in the MoBio protocol.
